content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a gentleman named Peter Schmidt. He was the potential landlord for the apartment in Magdeburg that I was interested in renting.
name: Max Müller

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for the apartment in Magdeburg. We had several rounds of negotiations until we reached an impasse where we could not find a mutually agreeable price.
name: Max Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] The negotiation did not result in a final agreement. The last offer I made was 500 Euros, and the landlord's last offer was 525 Euros.
name: Max Müller

content:
On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, 
how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Peter Schmidt, at 7. There were no personal issues, just a disagreement on the price.
name: Max Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. It was a straightforward disagreement on the rental price.
name: Max Müller
